intro: Thymus sibiricus, commonly known as Siberian thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the cold climates of Siberia and Central Asia. It features small, aromatic leaves and produces clusters of pink or white flowers in the summer. The plant is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a hardy species that thrives in full sun and is well adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Thymus sibiricus is also valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
